patterns: What should I do for a burn?
Which ointment to apply on burns?
What to do in case of a burn?

responses.eng: Cool the burn with running water for at least 10 minutes. Avoid using ice. Cover the burn with a sterile gauze bandage. Do not apply butter or ointments to the burn. For pain relief, consider over-the-counter pain relievers like ibuprofen or acetaminophen.
responses.fil: Palamigin ang paso gamit ang umaagos na tubig nang hindi bababa sa 10 minuto. Iwasang gumamit ng yelo. Takpan ang paso ng sterile gauze bandage. Huwag maglagay ng mantikilya o mga pamahid sa paso. Para sa lunas sa pananakit, isaalang-alang ang mga over-the-counter na pain reliever tulad ng ibuprofen o acetaminophen.

responses.eng: First, cool the burn under cool but not cold water for 10-20 minutes. Cover the burn with a clean, non-fluffy cloth or cling film. Take a painkiller such as paracetamol or ibuprofen.
responses.fil: Una, palamigin ang paso sa ilalim ng malamig ngunit hindi malamig na tubig sa loob ng 10-20 minuto. Takpan ang paso ng malinis, hindi malambot na tela o cling film. Uminom ng painkiller tulad ng paracetamol o ibuprofen.

patterns: What to do if I have a cut?
What medicine to use for a cut?

responses.eng: Clean the cut with soap and water to avoid infection. Apply pressure to stop the bleeding, and once stopped, apply an antibiotic ointment. Cover the wound with a bandage and change it daily. If the cut is deep, seek medical help.
responses.fil: Linisin ang hiwa gamit ang sabon at tubig upang maiwasan ang impeksyon. Lagyan ng presyon upang ihinto ang pagdurugo, at sa sandaling tumigil, maglagay ng antibiotic ointment. Takpan ang sugat ng benda at palitan ito araw-araw. Kung malalim ang hiwa, humingi ng medikal na tulong.

responses.eng: Wash the area with mild soap and water, then apply an antiseptic. Cover with a sterile bandage and monitor for signs of infection. For minor pain, over-the-counter painkillers can be used.
responses.fil: Hugasan ang lugar na may banayad na sabon at tubig, pagkatapos ay lagyan ng antiseptiko. Takpan ng sterile bandage at subaybayan ang mga palatandaan ng impeksyon. Para sa menor de edad na pananakit, maaaring gumamit ng mga over-the-counter na pangpawala ng sakit.

patterns: What to do if I have an abrasion?
What should I apply on an abrasion?

responses.eng: Clean the abrasion with water and soap to remove any debris. Apply an antiseptic to prevent infection. Cover with a sterile bandage or gauze and change it daily. Keep the area dry and monitor for signs of infection.
responses.fil: Linisin ang gasgas gamit ang tubig at sabon upang alisin ang anumang dumi. Maglagay ng antiseptiko upang maiwasan ang impeksyon. Takpan ng sterile na benda o gasa at palitan ito araw-araw. Panatilihing tuyo ang lugar at bantayan para sa mga senyales ng impeksyon.

responses.eng: Gently wash the abrasion with soap and water. Apply an antibiotic ointment and cover with a clean, dry bandage. If the abrasion is large, seek medical advice.
responses.fil: Maingat na hugasan ang gasgas gamit ang sabon at tubig. Maglagay ng antibiotic ointment at takpan ng malinis at tuyong benda. Kung malaki ang gasgas, magpakonsulta sa doktor.

patterns: What to do for insect stings?

responses.eng: Remove the stinger if present by scraping it off with a flat object. Wash the area with soap and water. Apply a cold compress to reduce swelling. Use an antihistamine cream or take oral antihistamines for itching. If you experience difficulty breathing, seek emergency medical help immediately.
responses.fil: Alisin ang tibo kung mayroon, sa pamamagitan ng pag-scrape gamit ang patag na bagay. Hugasan ang lugar na natibo gamit ang sabon at tubig. Maglagay ng malamig na pomento upang mabawasan ang pamamaga. Gumamit ng antihistamine cream o uminom ng oral antihistamines para sa pangangati. Kung makaranas ng hirap sa paghinga, agad na humingi ng tulong medikal.

responses.eng: Wash the sting site with soap and water. Apply ice wrapped in a cloth to reduce swelling. Take an antihistamine for itching or swelling.
responses.fil: Hugasan ang lugar ng sting gamit ang sabon at tubig. Maglagay ng yelo na binalot sa tela upang mabawasan ang pamamaga. Uminom ng antihistamine para sa pangangati o pamamaga.

patterns: What to do if I have a splinter?

responses.eng: Clean the area with soap and water. Use sterilized tweezers to remove the splinter carefully. After removal, apply an antiseptic and cover with a bandage if necessary
responses.fil: Linisin ang lugar gamit ang sabon at tubig. Gumamit ng sterilized na pang-ipit upang maingat na alisin ang tinik. Pagkatapos alisin, maglagay ng antiseptiko at takpan ng benda kung kinakailangan

responses.eng: Soak the affected area in warm water to soften the skin. Gently remove the splinter with sterilized tweezers. Clean the area with antiseptic and bandage if needed.
responses.fil: Ibabad ang apektadong lugar sa maligamgam na tubig upang lumambot ang balat. Maingat na alisin ang tinik gamit ang sterilized na pang-ipit. Linisin ang lugar gamit ang antiseptiko at takpan ng benda kung kinakailangan

patterns: What to do for a sprain?
How to treat a sprained ankle?

responses.eng: Rest the injured limb and avoid putting weight on it. Apply ice packs to reduce swelling and pain. Compress the area with an elastic bandage, and elevate it above heart level. Consider over-the-counter pain relievers for pain management
responses.fil: Pahingahin ang nasugatang bahagi at iwasan ang paglalagay ng bigat dito. Maglagay ng yelo upang mabawasan ang pamamaga at sakit. I-compress ang lugar gamit ang elastic na benda, at itaas ito sa taas ng puso. Isaalang-alang ang paggamit ng mga over-the-counter na gamot para sa sakit.

responses.eng: Use the R.I.C.E. method: Rest, Ice, Compression, and Elevation. If the pain persists or the swelling is severe, consult a healthcare provider.
responses.fil: Gamitin ang R.I.C.E. na pamamaraan: Rest, Ice, Compression, at Elevation. Kung patuloy ang sakit o malubha ang pamamaga, magpakonsulta sa isang healthcare provider.

patterns: What to do if I have a strain?
Best way to treat muscle strains?
How to heal a muscle strain?

responses.eng: Rest the strained muscle and avoid activities that cause pain. Apply ice to the area for 15-20 minutes several times a day. Use an elastic bandage to compress the area, and elevate it to reduce swelling. Over-the-counter painkillers can help manage pain.
responses.fil: Pahingahin ang na-pilay na kalamnan at iwasan ang mga aktibidad na nagdudulot ng sakit. Maglagay ng yelo sa apektadong lugar sa loob ng 15-20 minuto nang ilang beses sa isang araw. Gumamit ng elastic na benda upang i-compress ang lugar, at itaas ito upang mabawasan ang pamamaga. Ang mga over-the-counter na painkillers ay maaaring makatulong sa pamamahala ng sakit.

responses.eng: Rest the affected muscle, apply ice, and compress with a bandage. Elevate the limb and take pain relievers as needed.
responses.fil: Pahingahin ang apektadong kalamnan, maglagay ng yelo, at i-compress gamit ang benda. Itaas ang bahagi at uminom ng pain relievers kung kinakailangan.

patterns: What to do for a bruise?

responses.eng: Apply a cold compress to the bruise to reduce swelling. Elevate the affected area to minimize blood flow to the bruise. Rest and avoid further injury to the area. Over-the-counter pain relievers can help with discomfort.
responses.fil: Maglagay ng malamig na pomento sa pasa upang mabawasan ang pamamaga. Itaas ang apektadong lugar upang mabawasan ang daloy ng dugo sa pasa. Magpahinga at iwasan ang karagdagang pinsala sa lugar. Ang mga over-the-counter na pain relievers ay maaaring makatulong sa pag-alis ng hindi komportableng pakiramdam.

responses.eng: Use ice packs on the bruise for 10-15 minutes at a time. Keep the bruised area elevated and take pain relief medication if needed.
responses.fil: Gumamit ng yelo sa pasa sa loob ng 10-15 minuto bawat sesyon. Panatilihing nakataas ang lugar na may pasa at uminom ng gamot para sa sakit kung kinakailangan.

patterns: How to treat a pulled muscle?
What to do for a muscle pull?
Best way to heal a pulled muscle?
How to reduce pulled muscle pain?

responses.eng: Rest the affected muscle and apply ice to reduce swelling. Use compression with an elastic bandage and elevate the muscle to help reduce inflammation. Take pain relievers if needed and avoid strenuous activity until fully healed.
responses.fil: Pahingahin ang apektadong kalamnan at maglagay ng yelo upang mabawasan ang pamamaga. Gumamit ng compression gamit ang elastic na benda at itaas ang kalamnan upang makatulong sa pagbawas ng pamamaga. Uminom ng pain relievers kung kinakailangan at iwasan ang mabigat na aktibidad hanggang sa ganap na maghilom.

responses.eng: Apply the R.I.C.E. method: Rest, Ice, Compression, and Elevation. For persistent pain or severe muscle strain, consult a healthcare provider.
responses.fil: Gamitin ang R.I.C.E. na pamamaraan: Rest, Ice, Compression, at Elevation. Para sa patuloy na sakit o malubhang pilay ng kalamnan, magpakonsulta sa isang healthcare provider.

patterns: Best way to relieve sunburn pain?

responses.eng: Cool the skin with a damp cloth or take a cool bath. Apply aloe vera or a moisturizing lotion to soothe the skin. Drink plenty of water to stay hydrated and avoid further sun exposure. Over-the-counter pain relievers can help with discomfort.
responses.fil: Palamigin ang balat gamit ang basang tela o maligamgam na paligo. Maglagay ng aloe vera o moisturizing lotion upang mapagaan ang balat. Uminom ng maraming tubig upang manatiling hydrated at iwasan ang karagdagang pagkakalantad sa araw. Ang mga over-the-counter na pain relievers ay maaaring makatulong sa pag-alis ng hindi komportableng pakiramdam.

responses.eng: Use cool compresses and moisturize with aloe vera gel. Drink water and avoid the sun until the burn heals.
responses.fil: Gumamit ng malamig na pomento at maglagay ng aloe vera gel upang moisturize ang balat. Uminom ng tubig at iwasan ang araw hanggang sa maghilom ang paso.

patterns: What to do for a chemical burn?
How to relieve chemical burn pain?
Best way to heal a chemical burn?

responses.eng: Immediately flush the affected area with water for at least 20 minutes. Remove any contaminated clothing. Cover the burn with a sterile bandage and avoid applying creams or ointments unless instructed by a healthcare provider. Seek medical attention immediately.
responses.fil: Agad na banlawan ang apektadong lugar ng tubig sa loob ng hindi bababa sa 20 minuto. Alisin ang anumang maruming damit. Takpan ang paso ng sterile na benda at iwasan ang paglalagay ng mga creams o ointments maliban kung inutusan ng isang healthcare provider. Magpakonsulta sa doktor agad.

responses.eng: Rinse the burn with water continuously for 20 minutes and remove contaminated clothing. Seek immediate medical help.
responses.fil: Banlawan ang paso ng tubig ng tuluy-tuloy sa loob ng 20 minuto at alisin ang maruming damit. Humingi ng agarang medikal na tulong.

patterns: What to do for a rash?

responses.eng: Wash the affected area with mild soap and water. Apply an over-the-counter anti-itch cream or antihistamine. Avoid scratching to prevent infection. If the rash persists or is severe, consult a healthcare provider.
responses.fil: Hugasan ang apektadong lugar gamit ang mild na sabon at tubig. Maglagay ng over-the-counter na anti-itch cream o antihistamine. Iwasan ang pangangati upang maiwasan ang impeksyon. Kung ang pantal ay nagpapatuloy o malubha, magpakonsulta sa isang healthcare provider.

responses.eng: Clean the area gently, apply an anti-itch cream, and avoid irritants. Seek medical advice if the rash spreads or doesn't improve.
responses.fil: Linisin ang lugar ng maingat, maglagay ng anti-itch cream, at iwasan ang mga irritants. Humingi ng medikal na payo kung ang pantal ay kumakalat o hindi bumubuti.

patterns: What to do if bitten by a snake?
How to treat a snake bite?
How to manage a snake bite?
What to do for a snake bite?

responses.eng: Keep the bitten area still and below heart level to slow venom spread. Remove any tight clothing or jewelry near the bite. Do not attempt to suck out the venom. Seek emergency medical help immediately
responses.fil: Ipahinga ang tinukso na lugar at panatilihing nasa ilalim ng antas ng puso upang mapabagal ang pagkalat ng lason. Alisin ang anumang masikip na damit o alahas malapit sa kagat. Huwag subukang sipsipin ang lason. Humingi agad ng tulong medikal.

responses.eng: Stay calm and immobilize the bitten limb. Seek emergency medical care as quickly as possible
responses.fil: Manatiling kalmado at i-immobilize ang tinukso na bahagi. Humingi ng agarang medikal na pangangalaga sa lalong madaling panahon.

responses.eng: Call emergency services immediately. Keep the bite area still and lower than the heart. Do not apply ice or a tourniquet.
responses.fil: Tumawag agad ng emergency services. Panatilihing hindi gumagalaw ang lugar ng kagat at nasa ibaba ng puso. Huwag maglagay ng yelo o tourniquet.

patterns: What to do if I am bleeding?

responses.eng: Apply direct pressure to the wound with a clean cloth or bandage. If possible, elevate the injured area above heart level. Keep applying pressure until the bleeding stops. If the bleeding is severe, seek emergency medical help immediately.
responses.fil: Maglagay ng direktang pressure sa sugat gamit ang malinis na tela o benda. Kung maaari, itaas ang nasugatang lugar sa itaas ng antas ng puso. Patuloy na mag-aplay ng pressure hanggang sa tumigil ang pagdurugo. Kung malubha ang pagdurugo, humingi agad ng tulong medikal.

responses.eng: Use a clean cloth to apply pressure to the wound. Elevate the area if possible and seek medical attention for severe bleeding.
responses.fil: Gamitin ang malinis na tela upang mag-aplay ng pressure sa sugat. Itaas ang lugar kung maaari at humingi ng medikal na atensyon para sa malubhang pagdurugo.

patterns: What to do for a fracture?
How to treat a broken bone?
Best way to manage a fracture?

responses.eng: Keep the injured area still and avoid moving it. Apply a splint to immobilize the fracture and use a cold pack to reduce swelling. Seek immediate medical attention.
responses.fil: Ipahinga ang nasugatang lugar at iwasang galawin ito. Maglagay ng splint upang i-immobilize ang bali at gumamit ng cold pack upang mabawasan ang pamamaga. Humingi ng agarang medikal na atensyon.

responses.eng: Do not move the injured area and use a splint to keep it immobile. Apply ice and seek emergency medical help.
responses.fil: Huwag galawin ang nasugatang lugar at gamitin ang splint upang mapanatiling hindi gumagalaw ito. Maglagay ng yelo at humingi ng agarang medikal na tulong.

patterns: What to do for a fever?
Best way to bring down fever?

responses.eng: Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of fluids. Use over-the-counter fever reducers like acetaminophen or ibuprofen. Rest in a cool environment and wear lightweight clothing. If the fever is very high or persists, seek medical advice.
responses.fil: Manatiling hydrated sa pamamagitan ng pag-inom ng maraming likido. Gumamit ng over-the-counter na gamot para sa lagnat tulad ng acetaminophen o ibuprofen. Magpahinga sa isang malamig na kapaligiran at magsuot ng magagaan na damit. Kung ang lagnat ay napakataas o nagpapatuloy, magpakonsulta sa doktor.

responses.eng: Drink water, rest, and use fever-reducing medication. Seek medical care if the fever is very high or persists for more than a day.
responses.fil: Uminom ng tubig, magpahinga, at gumamit ng gamot para sa pagbawas ng lagnat. Humingi ng medikal na pangangalaga kung ang lagnat ay napakataas o nagpapatuloy ng higit sa isang araw.

patterns: How to help someone having a seizure?
What should I do for convulsions?

responses.eng: Protect the person from injury by removing nearby objects. Do not restrain them or put anything in their mouth. After the convulsions stop, place them in the recovery position and monitor their breathing. Seek emergency medical help.
responses.fil: Protektahan ang tao mula sa pinsala sa pamamagitan ng pagtanggal ng mga nakapaligid na bagay. Huwag silang pigilan o maglagay ng anumang bagay sa kanilang bibig. Pagkatapos huminto ang mga convulsions, ilagay sila sa recovery position at bantayan ang kanilang paghinga. Humingi ng agarang medikal na tulong.

responses.eng: Stay with the person and protect them from harm. Do not restrain them or place anything in their mouth. Call emergency services.
responses.fil: Manatili sa tabi ng tao at protektahan sila mula sa pinsala. Huwag silang pigilan o maglagay ng anumang bagay sa kanilang bibig. Tumawag ng emergency services.

patterns: What to do for chest pain?
What should I do if I have chest pain?
Best way to relieve chest pain?

responses.eng: If you experience chest pain, stop any physical activity and rest. Take deep breaths and try to stay calm. If the pain persists, seek emergency medical help immediately, as it could be a sign of a heart attack.
responses.fil: Kung makaranas ka ng pananakit sa dibdib, itigil ang anumang pisikal na aktibidad at magpahinga. Huminga ng malalim at subukang manatiling kalmado. Kung magpapatuloy ang sakit, humingi ng agarang medikal na tulong, dahil maaari itong senyales ng atake sa puso.

responses.eng: Rest and take slow, deep breaths. Seek emergency medical attention if the pain is severe or does not go away.
responses.fil: Magpahinga at huminga ng mabagal at malalim. Humingi ng agarang medikal na atensyon kung ang sakit ay malubha o hindi nawawala.

patterns: What to do if I feel dizzy?

responses.eng: Sit or lie down immediately and rest until the dizziness passes. Drink plenty of water and avoid sudden movements. If dizziness persists or is accompanied by other symptoms, seek medical attention.
responses.fil: Umupo o humiga agad at magpahinga hanggang sa mawala ang pagkahilo. Uminom ng maraming tubig at iwasan ang biglaang paggalaw. Kung magpapatuloy ang pagkahilo o sinasamahan ng iba pang sintomas, magpakonsulta sa doktor.

responses.eng: Sit or lie down and drink water. Avoid sudden movements. If dizziness continues, consult a doctor.
responses.fil: Umupo o humiga at uminom ng tubig. Iwasan ang biglaang paggalaw. Kung magpatuloy ang pagkahilo, magpakonsulta sa doktor.

patterns: What to do for heat stroke?
Best way to cool down from heat stroke?
Best way to recover from heat stroke?

responses.eng: Move to a cooler place and lie down with your legs slightly elevated. Apply cool water to your skin and use a fan to help with cooling. Drink cool water or an electrolyte drink, but avoid sugary or alcoholic beverages. Seek emergency medical attention immediately.
responses.fil: Lumipat sa isang mas malamig na lugar at humiga na may bahagyang itaas ang mga binti. Maglagay ng malamig na tubig sa iyong balat at gumamit ng pamaypay upang makatulong sa pagpapalamig. Uminom ng malamig na tubig o electrolyte drink, ngunit iwasan ang matatamis o alcoholic na inumin. Humingi ng agarang medikal na tulong.

responses.eng: Get to a cool place, remove excess clothing, and apply cold packs or wet cloths. Drink cool water or sports drinks, and seek immediate medical help.
responses.fil: Pumunta sa isang malamig na lugar, alisin ang sobrang damit, at maglagay ng cold packs o basang tela. Uminom ng malamig na tubig o sports drinks, at humingi ng agarang medikal na tulong.

responses.eng: Call emergency services immediately. Move the person to a cool area and remove excess clothing. Use cool water or ice packs to lower their body temperature. Keep monitoring their condition until help arrives.
responses.fil: Tumawag agad ng emergency services. Ilipat ang tao sa isang malamig na lugar at alisin ang sobrang damit. Gumamit ng malamig na tubig o ice packs upang ibaba ang kanilang temperatura ng katawan. Patuloy na bantayan ang kanilang kondisyon hanggang dumating ang tulong.

responses.eng: Seek emergency medical help. Cool the person down with water or ice packs and stay with them until help arrives.
responses.fil: Humingi ng agarang medikal na tulong. Palamigin ang tao gamit ang tubig o ice packs at manatili sa kanilang tabi hanggang dumating ang tulong.

patterns: What to do if someone is having a heart attack?
How to treat a heart attack?
How to recognize a heart attack?

responses.eng: Call emergency services immediately. Help the person to sit down and stay calm. If available, give them aspirin to chew slowly unless they are allergic or have been advised not to by a doctor. If they lose consciousness, begin CPR if trained to do so.
responses.fil: Tumawag agad ng emergency services. Tulungan ang tao na umupo at manatiling kalmado. Kung maaari, bigyan sila ng aspirin upang nguyain ng dahan-dahan maliban kung sila ay allergic o inutusan ng doktor na huwag gawin ito. Kung mawalan sila ng malay, simulan ang CPR kung ikaw ay sinanay sa paggawa nito.

responses.eng: Call for emergency medical help right away. Keep the person calm and have them chew aspirin if not allergic.
responses.fil: Tumawag agad ng tulong medikal. Panatilihing kalmado ang tao at hayaang nguyain nila ang aspirin kung hindi sila allergic.

patterns: What to do if someone has a stroke?
Best way to help during a stroke?
What to do during a stroke?
What to do if someone is having a stroke?

responses.eng: If you suspect someone is having a stroke, call emergency services immediately. Have the person lie down with their head slightly elevated. Monitor their breathing and be ready to perform CPR if necessary.
responses.fil: Kung sa tingin mo ay may stroke ang isang tao, tumawag agad ng emergency services. Hayaang humiga ang tao na may bahagyang itaas ang ulo. Bantayan ang kanilang paghinga at maging handa na magsagawa ng CPR kung kinakailangan.

responses.eng: Seek emergency medical help immediately. Keep the person calm and monitor their breathing.
responses.fil: Humingi agad ng tulong medikal. Panatilihing kalmado ang tao at bantayan ang kanilang paghinga.

responses.eng: Act FAST: Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call emergency services. Call emergency services immediately and note the time the symptoms began. Keep the person comfortable and calm until help arrives.
responses.fil: Gumamit ng FAST: Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call emergency services. Tumawag agad ng emergency services at tandaan ang oras ng pagsisimula ng mga sintomas. Panatilihin ang tao na komportable at kalmado hanggang dumating ang tulong.

responses.eng: Call emergency services immediately if you notice face drooping, arm weakness, or speech difficulty. Act FAST and get medical help right away.
responses.fil: Tumawag agad ng emergency services kung mapansin ang pag-dagilid ng mukha, kahinaan ng braso, o kahirapan sa pagsasalita. Kumilos ng FAST at kumuha ng medikal na tulong kaagad.

responses.eng: Drink plenty of water or an oral rehydration solution (ORS). Rest in a cool environment and avoid physical activity until fully rehydrated. For severe dehydration, seek medical attention.
responses.fil: Uminom ng maraming tubig o oral rehydration solution (ORS). Magpahinga sa isang malamig na kapaligiran at iwasan ang pisikal na aktibidad hanggang sa ganap na ma-rehydrate. Para sa malubhang dehydration, humingi ng medikal na tulong.

responses.eng: Increase fluid intake, rest, and use an ORS if available. Seek medical help if dehydration is severe.
responses.fil: Dagdagan ang pag-inom ng likido, magpahinga, at gumamit ng ORS kung available. Humingi ng tulong medikal kung ang dehydration ay malubha.

patterns: What to do for a stuffy nose?
Best way to clear nasal congestion?
How to treat a blocked nose?

responses.eng: Use a saline nasal spray or steam inhalation to clear the nasal passages. Stay hydrated and use a humidifier if needed. Over-the-counter decongestants can also help relieve symptoms.
responses.fil: Gumamit ng saline nasal spray o steam inhalation upang linisin ang mga nasal passages. Manatiling hydrated at gumamit ng humidifier kung kinakailangan. Ang mga over-the-counter na decongestants ay maaari ring makatulong sa pagpapaluwag ng mga sintomas.

responses.eng: Try steam inhalation, saline spray, and stay hydrated. Consider using a decongestant if symptoms persist.
responses.fil: Subukan ang steam inhalation, saline spray, at manatiling hydrated. Isaalang-alang ang paggamit ng decongestant kung ang mga sintomas ay nagpapatuloy.

patterns: What to do for a cough?
How to relieve a persistent cough?

responses.eng: Drink warm fluids like tea with honey. Use a humidifier to add moisture to the air. Over-the-counter cough syrups or lozenges can help soothe your throat. If the cough persists for more than a week, consult a healthcare provider.
responses.fil: Uminom ng mainit na likido tulad ng tsaa na may honey. Gumamit ng humidifier upang magdagdag ng moisture sa hangin. Ang mga over-the-counter na cough syrups o lozenges ay maaaring makatulong upang maibsan ang sore throat. Kung ang ubo ay nagpapatuloy ng higit sa isang linggo, magpakonsulta sa healthcare provider.

responses.eng: Stay hydrated, use cough drops, and consider a humidifier. If the cough persists, seek medical advice.
responses.fil: Manatiling hydrated, gumamit ng cough drops, at isaalang-alang ang paggamit ng humidifier. Kung ang ubo ay nagpapatuloy, humingi ng medikal na payo.

patterns: What to do for stomach pain?
Best way to relieve abdominal pain?

responses.eng: Rest and avoid heavy meals. Drink clear fluids and apply a warm compress to the abdomen. Over-the-counter antacids or pain relievers can help. If the pain is severe or persistent, seek medical attention.
responses.fil: Magpahinga at iwasan ang mabibigat na pagkain. Uminom ng malinaw na likido at maglagay ng mainit na compress sa tiyan. Ang mga over-the-counter na antacids o pain relievers ay maaaring makatulong. Kung ang sakit ay malubha o nagpapatuloy, humingi ng medikal na tulong.

responses.eng: Rest and stay hydrated. Use a warm compress and take pain relief medication if needed. Consult a healthcare provider if the pain persists.
responses.fil: Magpahinga at manatiling hydrated. Gumamit ng mainit na compress at uminom ng gamot para sa sakit kung kinakailangan. Magpakonsulta sa healthcare provider kung ang sakit ay nagpapatuloy.

patterns: How to treat a broken toe?
What to do for a broken toe?
Best way to heal a broken toe?
How to manage a broken toe?

responses.eng: Rest and avoid putting weight on the toe. Apply ice to reduce swelling and elevate the foot. Use a splint or buddy tape the toe to the adjacent one. Seek medical attention if the pain is severe.
responses.fil: Magpahinga at iwasang maglagay ng bigat sa daliri sa paa. Maglagay ng yelo upang mabawasan ang pamamaga at itaas ang paa. Gumamit ng splint o i-tape ang daliri sa paa sa katabing daliri. Humingi ng medikal na tulong kung ang sakit ay malubha.

responses.eng: Elevate the foot, apply ice, and tape the toe to the next one. Consult a healthcare provider if necessary.
responses.fil: Itaas ang paa, maglagay ng yelo, at i-tape ang daliri sa katabing daliri. Magpakonsulta sa healthcare provider kung kinakailangan.

patterns: What to do if someone is choking?
How to help someone who is choking?
What to do if someone is choking?
How to help someone who is choking?

responses.eng: If someone is choking, ask if they can speak or cough. If they cannot, perform the Heimlich maneuver by standing behind them, wrapping your arms around their waist, and giving quick, upward thrusts below their ribcage. Call emergency services immediately.
responses.fil: Kung ang isang tao ay nasasakal, tanungin kung sila ay makapagsalita o makakaugong. Kung hindi nila magawa, isagawa ang Heimlich maneuver sa pamamagitan ng pagtayo sa likuran nila, pagyakap sa kanilang baywang, at pagbibigay ng mabilis at pataas na puwersa sa ilalim ng kanilang ribcage. Tumawag agad ng emergency services.

responses.eng: Perform the Heimlich maneuver or back blows to dislodge the object. Call emergency services if the person cannot breathe.
responses.fil: Isagawa ang Heimlich maneuver o back blows upang alisin ang bagay. Tumawag ng emergency services kung ang tao ay hindi makakahinga.

responses.eng: If the person is unable to speak, cough, or breathe, perform the Heimlich maneuver: Stand behind the person, place your arms around their waist, make a fist with one hand, place it above their navel, and give quick, upward thrusts. If the person becomes unconscious, begin CPR and call emergency services.
responses.fil: Kung ang tao ay hindi makapagsalita, makakaugong, o makahinga, isagawa ang Heimlich maneuver: Tumayo sa likuran ng tao, ilagay ang iyong mga braso sa kanilang baywang, gumawa ng kamao gamit ang isang kamay, ilagay ito sa itaas ng kanilang pusod, at bigyan ng mabilis, pataas na puwersa. Kung ang tao ay mawalan ng malay, simulan ang CPR at tumawag ng emergency services.

responses.eng: Perform the Heimlich maneuver by standing behind the person and giving quick, upward abdominal thrusts. Call emergency services if needed.
responses.fil: Isagawa ang Heimlich maneuver sa pamamagitan ng pagtayo sa likuran ng tao at pagbibigay ng mabilis, pataas na abdominal thrusts. Tumawag ng emergency services kung kinakailangan.

responses.eng: Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of fluids like water or an oral rehydration solution. Avoid solid foods until the symptoms improve. Over-the-counter anti-diarrheal medications can be used, but consult a healthcare provider if symptoms persist.
responses.fil: Manatiling hydrated sa pamamagitan ng pag-inom ng maraming likido tulad ng tubig o oral rehydration solution. Iwasan ang solidong pagkain hanggang sa bumuti ang mga sintomas. Maaaring gumamit ng over-the-counter na anti-diarrheal medications, ngunit magpakonsulta sa healthcare provider kung ang mga sintomas ay nagpapatuloy.

responses.eng: Drink fluids, avoid solid food, and consider over-the-counter medications. Seek medical help if symptoms persist.
responses.fil: Uminom ng likido, iwasan ang solidong pagkain, at isaalang-alang ang paggamit ng over-the-counter na mga gamot. Humingi ng medikal na tulong kung ang mga sintomas ay nagpapatuloy.

patterns: What to do for heat exhaustion?
Best way to recover from heat exhaustion?

responses.eng: Move to a cool, shaded area and drink plenty of water. Loosen or remove clothing and apply cool, wet cloths to the skin. Rest until fully recovered. If symptoms worsen, seek medical help.
responses.fil: Lumipat sa isang malamig at may anino na lugar at uminom ng maraming tubig. Alisin o luwagan ang damit at maglagay ng malamig, basang tela sa balat. Magpahinga hanggang sa ganap na mag-recover. Kung lumalala ang mga sintomas, humingi ng medikal na tulong.

responses.eng: Cool down, hydrate, and rest in a shaded area. Seek medical attention if symptoms do not improve.
responses.fil: Palamigin ang katawan, manatiling hydrated, at magpahinga sa isang lugar na may anino. Humingi ng medikal na atensyon kung ang mga sintomas ay hindi bumubuti.

patterns: What to do for a nosebleed?
Best way to stop nose bleeding?

responses.eng: Sit up straight and lean slightly forward. Pinch the soft part of your nose and hold for 10-15 minutes. Apply a cold compress to the bridge of the nose. If the bleeding continues for more than 20 minutes, seek medical attention.
responses.fil: Umupo ng tuwid at magyuko ng bahagya pasulong. Pisilin ang malambot na bahagi ng iyong ilong at hawakan ito ng 10-15 minuto. Maglagay ng malamig na compress sa tulay ng ilong. Kung ang pagdurugo ay magpapatuloy ng higit sa 20 minuto, humingi ng medikal na tulong.

responses.eng: Lean forward, pinch your nose, and hold until the bleeding stops. Use a cold compress and seek medical help if the bleeding doesn't stop.
responses.fil: Yuko pasulong, pisilin ang iyong ilong, at hawakan hanggang sa tumigil ang pagdurugo. Gumamit ng malamig na compress at humingi ng medikal na tulong kung ang pagdurugo ay hindi tumitigil.

responses.eng: Sit up straight and lean forward slightly. Pinch the soft part of your nose with your thumb and index finger for 10-15 minutes. Breathe through your mouth and avoid lying down. Apply a cold compress to the bridge of your nose. Seek medical help if the bleeding doesn't stop after 20 minutes.
responses.fil: Umupo ng tuwid at magyuko ng bahagya pasulong. Pisilin ang malambot na bahagi ng iyong ilong gamit ang iyong hinlalaki at hintuturo ng 10-15 minuto. Huminga sa pamamagitan ng iyong bibig at iwasang humiga. Maglagay ng malamig na compress sa tulay ng iyong ilong. Humingi ng medikal na tulong kung ang pagdurugo ay hindi tumitigil pagkatapos ng 20 minuto.

responses.eng: Tilt your head forward and pinch your nose just below the bridge. Hold for 10-15 minutes and avoid blowing your nose afterward.
responses.fil: Itilt ang iyong ulo pasulong at pisilin ang iyong ilong sa ilalim ng tulay. Hawakan ito ng 10-15 minuto at iwasang sabunin ang iyong ilong pagkatapos.

patterns: What to do if I have rectal bleeding?
What to do for rectal bleeding?

responses.eng: Stay calm and avoid straining during bowel movements. Increase fiber intake and drink plenty of water to ease bowel movements. Seek medical attention to determine the cause and receive appropriate treatment.
responses.fil: Manatiling kalmado at iwasang mag-igting sa panahon ng pagdumi. Dagdagan ang iyong fiber intake at uminom ng maraming tubig upang mapadali ang pagdumi. Humingi ng medikal na tulong upang matukoy ang sanhi at makatanggap ng angkop na paggamot.

responses.eng: Increase fiber and water intake. Avoid straining and consult a healthcare provider to determine the cause.
responses.fil: Dagdagan ang fiber at water intake. Iwasan ang pag-igting at kumonsulta sa healthcare provider upang matukoy ang sanhi.

patterns: What to do if I have testicle pain?
Best way to relieve testicle pain?

responses.eng: Rest and avoid strenuous activity. Apply ice to the affected area and wear supportive underwear. If the pain persists or is severe, seek medical attention.
responses.fil: Magpahinga at iwasan ang mabibigat na aktibidad. Maglagay ng yelo sa apektadong lugar at magsuot ng supportive na underwear. Kung ang sakit ay nagpapatuloy o malubha, humingi ng medikal na tulong.

responses.eng: Rest, use ice, and wear supportive clothing. Seek medical advice if the pain is severe or does not improve.
responses.fil: Magpahinga, gumamit ng yelo, at magsuot ng supportive na damit. Humingi ng medikal na payo kung ang sakit ay malubha o hindi bumubuti.

patterns: What to do if I have vertigo?

responses.eng: Sit or lie down immediately when feeling dizzy. Avoid sudden head movements and rest in a dark, quiet room. Stay hydrated and seek medical advice if symptoms persist.
responses.fil: Umupo o humiga agad kapag nakakaramdam ng pagkahilo. Iwasan ang biglaang paggalaw ng ulo at magpahinga sa isang madilim at tahimik na kwarto. Manatiling hydrated at humingi ng medikal na payo kung ang mga sintomas ay nagpapatuloy.

responses.eng: Rest and avoid sudden movements. Stay hydrated and consult a healthcare provider if the symptoms continue.
responses.fil: Magpahinga at iwasan ang biglaang paggalaw. Manatiling hydrated at kumonsulta sa healthcare provider kung ang mga sintomas ay nagpapatuloy.

patterns: What to do if I have an eye injury?
How to treat an eye injury?
Best way to manage an eye injury?
How to care for an eye injury?

responses.eng: Avoid rubbing the eye and rinse it with clean water. If there is a foreign object in the eye, do not attempt to remove it yourself. Cover the eye with a clean cloth or eye patch and seek medical attention immediately.
responses.fil: Iwasan ang pagdila sa mata at banlawan ito ng malinis na tubig. Kung may banyagang bagay sa mata, huwag subukang alisin ito nang mag-isa. Takpan ang mata ng malinis na tela o eye patch at humingi ng agarang medikal na tulong.

responses.eng: Rinse the eye with clean water and avoid rubbing it. Seek emergency medical help, especially if there is a foreign object in the eye.
responses.fil: Banlawan ang mata ng malinis na tubig at iwasan ang pagdila dito. Humingi ng agarang medikal na tulong, lalo na kung may banyagang bagay sa mata.

patterns: What to do for food poisoning?
Best way to recover from food poisoning?

responses.eng: Stay hydrated by drinking clear fluids like water or oral rehydration solutions. Rest and avoid solid foods until symptoms subside. If symptoms are severe or persistent, seek medical attention.
responses.fil: Manatiling hydrated sa pamamagitan ng pag-inom ng malinaw na likido tulad ng tubig o oral rehydration solutions. Magpahinga at iwasan ang solidong pagkain hanggang sa humupa ang mga sintomas. Kung ang mga sintomas ay malubha o nagpapatuloy, humingi ng medikal na tulong.

responses.eng: Drink clear fluids, rest, and avoid solid food until symptoms improve. Consult a healthcare provider if symptoms persist.
responses.fil: Uminom ng malinaw na likido, magpahinga, at iwasan ang solidong pagkain hanggang sa bumuti ang mga sintomas. Kumonsulta sa healthcare provider kung ang mga sintomas ay nagpapatuloy.

patterns: What to do during a seizure?
How to help someone having a seizure?
Best way to manage a seizure?
What should I do for a seizure?
What to do if someone is having a seizure?
How to help during a seizure?

responses.eng: Stay calm and protect the person from injury by moving nearby objects. Do not restrain them or put anything in their mouth. Once the seizure ends, place them in the recovery position and monitor their breathing. Seek emergency medical help.
responses.fil: Manatiling kalmado at protektahan ang tao mula sa pinsala sa pamamagitan ng pag-aalis ng mga bagay na malapit sa kanila. Huwag silang pigilan o maglagay ng anumang bagay sa kanilang bibig. Kapag natapos na ang seizure, ilagay sila sa recovery position at bantayan ang kanilang paghinga. Humingi ng agarang medikal na tulong.

responses.eng: Protect the person from harm, do not restrain them, and call emergency services. Place them in the recovery position once the seizure stops.
responses.fil: Protektahan ang tao mula sa pinsala, huwag silang pigilan, at tumawag ng emergency services. Ilagay sila sa recovery position kapag natapos ang seizure.

responses.eng: Do not restrain the person. Move any dangerous objects away from them. Cushion their head and time the seizure. Once the seizure stops, place them in the recovery position and stay with them until they are fully conscious. Seek medical attention if it's their first seizure or if the seizure lasts more than 5 minutes.
responses.fil: Huwag pigilan ang tao. Ilipat ang anumang panganib na bagay mula sa kanila. Pahiran ang kanilang ulo at itala ang oras ng seizure. Kapag natapos ang seizure, ilagay sila sa recovery position at manatili sa kanilang tabi hanggang sa sila ay ganap na magising. Humingi ng medikal na tulong kung ito ang kanilang unang seizure o kung ang seizure ay tumatagal ng higit sa 5 minuto.

responses.eng: Move objects away from the person to prevent injury and cushion their head. Don't restrain them or put anything in their mouth. After the seizure, help them into the recovery position and seek medical help.
responses.fil: Ilipat ang mga bagay mula sa tao upang maiwasan ang pinsala at pahiran ang kanilang ulo. Huwag silang pigilan o maglagay ng anumang bagay sa kanilang bibig. Pagkatapos ng seizure, tulungan silang pumunta sa recovery position at humingi ng medikal na tulong.

patterns: What to do for a head injury?
How to treat a head injury?
Best way to manage a head injury?
How to care for a head injury?

responses.eng: If the injury is minor, apply a cold compress to reduce swelling and rest. For more serious injuries, seek emergency medical help immediately. Keep the person awake and monitor their symptoms closely.
responses.fil: Kung ang pinsala ay maliit, maglagay ng malamig na compress upang mabawasan ang pamamaga at magpahinga. Para sa mas seryosong pinsala, humingi ng agarang medikal na tulong. Panatilihing gising ang tao at bantayan ang kanilang mga sintomas.

responses.eng: Use a cold compress for minor injuries. For serious head injuries, seek immediate medical help and monitor the person's condition.
responses.fil: Gumamit ng malamig na compress para sa maliit na pinsala. Para sa seryosong pinsala sa ulo, humingi ng agarang medikal na tulong at bantayan ang kondisyon ng tao.

patterns: What to do if someone faints?
How to help someone who fainted?
What should I do for fainting?

responses.eng: Help the person lie down and elevate their legs to improve blood flow to the brain. Loosen any tight clothing and keep them lying down until they recover. If they don't regain consciousness quickly, seek medical help immediately.
responses.fil: Tulungan ang tao na humiga at itaas ang kanilang mga binti upang mapabuti ang daloy ng dugo sa utak. Luwagan ang anumang masisikip na damit at panatilihing nakahiga sila hanggang sa sila ay makabawi. Kung hindi sila agad bumalik sa malay, humingi ng agarang medikal na tulong.

responses.eng: Have the person lie down, elevate their legs, and loosen tight clothing. Seek medical attention if they don't regain consciousness.
responses.fil: Pahigain ang tao, itaas ang kanilang mga binti, at luwagan ang masisikip na damit. Humingi ng medikal na tulong kung hindi sila bumalik sa malay.

patterns: What to do for a headache?
Best way to relieve a headache?

responses.eng: Rest in a quiet, dark room and apply a cold or warm compress to your forehead. Over-the-counter pain relievers like ibuprofen or acetaminophen can help. Stay hydrated and avoid triggers like bright lights or loud noises.
responses.fil: Magpahinga sa isang tahimik at madilim na kwarto at maglagay ng malamig o mainit na compress sa iyong noo. Maaaring makatulong ang mga over-the-counter na pain relievers tulad ng ibuprofen o acetaminophen. Manatiling hydrated at iwasan ang mga trigger tulad ng maliwanag na ilaw o malalakas na tunog.

responses.eng: Rest, use pain relief medication, and apply a compress. Stay hydrated and avoid known triggers.
responses.fil: Magpahinga, gumamit ng gamot para sa sakit, at maglagay ng compress. Manatiling hydrated at iwasan ang mga kilalang trigger.

patterns: What to do for a cold?
Best way to get over a cold?

responses.eng: Rest and stay hydrated by drinking plenty of fluids. Use over-the-counter medications to relieve symptoms like congestion and sore throat. Inhale steam or use a humidifier to ease breathing. If symptoms persist or worsen, consult a healthcare provider.
responses.fil: Magpahinga at manatiling hydrated sa pamamagitan ng pag-inom ng maraming likido. Gumamit ng mga over-the-counter na gamot para maibsan ang mga sintomas tulad ng congestion at sore throat. Huminga ng steam o gumamit ng humidifier upang mapadali ang paghinga. Kung ang mga sintomas ay nagpapatuloy o lumalala, kumonsulta sa healthcare provider.

responses.eng: Stay hydrated, rest, and use medications for symptom relief. Seek medical advice if the cold persists or worsens.
responses.fil: Manatiling hydrated, magpahinga, at gumamit ng mga gamot para sa pag-alis ng sintomas. Humingi ng medikal na payo kung ang sipon ay nagpapatuloy o lumalala.

patterns: What to do if someone is drowning?
How to save someone who is drowning?
Best way to help a drowning person?
What should I do if someone is drowning?

responses.eng: Call for emergency help immediately. If it's safe, try to reach the person with a pole or throw a flotation device. Do not enter the water unless you're trained in water rescue. Once the person is out of the water, check for breathing and start CPR if necessary.
responses.fil: Tumawag ng agarang tulong sa emergency. Kung ligtas, subukang abutin ang tao gamit ang isang poste o ihagis ang flotation device. Huwag pumasok sa tubig maliban kung ikaw ay may pagsasanay sa water rescue. Kapag ang tao ay nailabas na sa tubig, suriin ang kanilang paghinga at simulan ang CPR kung kinakailangan.

responses.eng: Call emergency services and try to help without putting yourself at risk. Use a pole or flotation device, and be ready to perform CPR.
responses.fil: Tumawag ng emergency services at subukang tumulong nang hindi inilalagay ang iyong sarili sa panganib. Gumamit ng poste o flotation device, at maging handa na magsagawa ng CPR.

responses.eng: Hello! How can I assist you today?
responses.fil: Kamusta! Paano kita matutulungan ngayon?

responses.eng: Hi there! What first aid information do you need?
responses.fil: Hi! Anong impormasyon tungkol sa first aid ang kailangan mo?

responses.eng: Hey! How can I help you today?
responses.fil: Hello! Paano kita matutulungan ngayon?

responses.eng: You're welcome! Stay safe!
responses.fil: Walang anuman! Mag ingat palagi!

responses.eng: Happy to help! Take care!
responses.fil: Masaya akong makatulong! Mag-ingat ka!

responses.eng: No problem! Glad I could assist.
responses.fil: Walang problema! Natutuwa akong nakatulong.
